page.title: 06IRVINE * COUNCIL HOUSING
page.content:
{Local government}is administered by Cunninghame District Council, who are also responsible for much of the housing in the New Town. In Irvine New Town there is a house waiting list for each individual area.
{There is a wide range of houses, {including :_ flats, multi-storey flats, semi-detached, terraced and maisonettes. Of the houses in C.D.C. 22,756 houses are rented, however the District Council have a policy of selling houses to sitting tenants under the tenants rights, etc,.in Scotland Act l98O. Up to March l985 l2l7 houses have been sold. The oldest council houses in Irvine are in Kirk Vennel, built in 1914, and the most recent are in Cotton Row, built in 1985.
